description: Basic schema for ingesting events into plyzen

correlationId.description: (optional) Identifier for associating multiple records as the same activity (e.g. associate start to end events of the same activity, send data in chunks, or upsert/merge previously sent activity data). Will be generated, if not provided

namespace.description: (optional) The artifact's namespace (e.g. to make generally named artifacts like core-lib distinguishable); defaults to 'default'

artifact.description: The artifact's unique name within the namespace

environment.description: The environment's name (e.g. prod) in which the activity takes place

instance.description: (optional) Name of the environment instance. For some environments multiple instances exist (e.g. a certain kubernetes namspace)

activity.description: (optional, if properties activityName and activityType exist) Name of the activity that must imply the activity type by containing on of the substrings 'build', 'deploy', 'test', 'alarm'

activityName.description: (optional, if activity property exists) Name of the activity

activityType.description: (optional, if activity property exists) Type of the activity: build, deployment, test

event.description: Type of the event: start, finish

timestamp.description: (optional) Time stamp of the event, defaults to current timestamp

result.description: (optional) Result of the activity: success, failure. Defaults to 'success' for events of type 'finish'.

product.description: (optional) Name of the product, if the activity belongs to a compound action (e.g. deploying multiple artifact together as one product release). This usually only makes sense in combination with the correlationId property.
